item.title: Minimum Spanning Tree
item.description: Description A Minimum Spanning Tree (MST) of a weighted, connected, undirected graph is a tree that spans all the vertices in the graph and has the minimum possible total edge weight among all the trees that can be created from the graph. In simpler terms, it’s a subgraph that includes all the vertices, is a tree (meaning it has no cycles), and the sum of its edge weights is as small as possible.
